page.title: 14Ceres Primary School
page.content: The Primary School in Ceres has been in existence since 1836. The original name, Ceres Parochial Academy, is carved in stone and can be seen above the main entrance. It was renovated in 1961 and additional classrooms were added. Today the school holds 86 pupils aged from five to twelve years. There are four class teachers and visiting specialist teachers of Drama, Music, Art and Craft and Physical Education. After school, interested pupils can attend a gymnastics club and, during the winter months, a badminton club. There are also evening classes for adults from October to March each year in Keep Fit, Scottish Country Dancing, Piping, and Choral Singing. A total of about 60 people attend these classes.
